fields.description:
The new UI provides the functional match of the 4 dialogs in the IP landing page.

- allocate IP address
- associate with instance
- disassociate with instance
- release to cloud
fields.summary: Functional Match of 4 Dialogs on IP Landing Page

comments.body: release to cloud should be on landing page, not single IP page.

* allocate dialog content does not match wireframe
* associate dialog does not match wireframe, and does not autosuggest matching instances when user types in field (does not seem to allow typing in field at all)
*disassociate dialog does not show instance name/ID

- allocate dialog content does not match wireframe (done)
- associate dialog does not match wireframe, and does not autosuggest matching instances when user types in field (does not seem to allow typing in field at all) [done]
- disassociate dialog does not show instance name/ID (done)

Quick note on the Associate dialogâ€¦

We can't exactly match the instance choice label with what's spec'd in the wireframe at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Associate+Address+with+Instance
since the label is generated from a form label that is marked for translation.  Hope that's ok.
[~jloza]: Got a couple of fixes to make.  Will resubmit for UX review once those are ready.

looking good! except:

* disassociate is not displaying the instance name. Attaching screenshot showing IP associated with instance "Manny" and the dialog did not display the instance name (ID).

See attached screenshot.

I clicked the IP from the instances landing page (table view) and the page it is trying to display, but can't, shows Key Pairs > <IP ADDRESS> in the URL. I think this is just pointing to the wrong thing, should be an easy fix.

Also, I am not seeing the instance name Manny showing for IP 97 on the IP detail page -or- the disassociate from instance dialog. I pulled from develop this morning. 

Thanks!
Fixes committed in http://git.io/AOSRuA and http://git.io/0iJzTA

still not seeing image name on disassociate modal (everything else previously mentioned is fixed, yay). Attaching 2 screenshots, one of IP detail page that shows the instance name and ID, one of the disassociate modal that shows the same ID but no name)

I'm seeing the instance name in the Disassociate dialog.  
Screenshot attached (ipdialog.png)

Ah, so the confusion was where we are launching the disassociate dialog from.  We weren't properly passing the instance name to the dialog from the IP detail page. Fixed now thanks to http://git.io/mN9ZUA

Apologies for the confusion!
